Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2010 08:45PM bethen wrote: This twice a day radiation is beginning to get tiring.  The first one is usually at 8 am and the second one has to be a minimum of 6 hours later.  Of course, it is usually later than that, anywhere between 3 and 5 pm.   At least now I am at the half way mark and on the down side.  Yeh!!!!!!!!!!!!  As far as my skin is concerned, I really do not have any pain but I do have lots of bumps that look like hives and my goodness are they itchy.  All I want to do it scratch scratch and scratch some more.  What does everyone use for the itching, my doctor told me to try Benydryl?  Hope everyone is doing good so far. Betsy (#2)
Posts.Title: October 2010 rads mamaof3bugs JFV

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2010 06:55PM bethen wrote: Hi Everyone..........Started my radiation last Wed.  Is anyone else having double dose radiation?  I am having it twice a day (must be a minimum of 6 hours apart) for seventeen days (total of 34 treatments) and then will be having 6 - 8 boosts directly to the tumor.  I had a mastectomy five years ago along with chemo and radiation, unfortunately they did not radiate the area directly below my collar bone at that time, and so it happens that my cancer has returned to two lymph nodes in that area.  My oncologist has some concerns about the possibility of crossover radiation and the damage that could be done to the area that was radiated before, but time will tell.  I am already starting to get a bit of a sore throat, no burning yet.  Good luck to everyone out there and I will think of you all, each and every day that I lay on that radiation bed.   All the best Betsy
Posts.Title: October 2010 rads mamaof3bugs JFV

Posts.Content: bethen wrote: Hi Just wondering if anyone else has experienced the side effects that I have had from radiation.  Three weeks into my radiation I started having trouble getting my arm up into the tray that holds my arm.  I am 6 months out of radiation now and still have not got the mobility back in my shoulder.   Before radiation I had full mobility of the arm and shoulder even after my mastectomy I had no problem.  It even hurts to lie on my side of that shoulder, feels almost like it is going to break if I try to lift it too high.  Anyone else have this problem, would love to hear about it.  Thanks. Betsy Betsy Dx 9/27/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, 3/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Radiation on the Shoulder bethen 4thefather

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2015 10:46AM bethen wrote: thank you Music Lover. I was so looking forward to that wedding. They asked me if I would like them to move up the wedding, but I really don't want them to do that, all has been planned and I will not let them change it for me. At least I know they are getting married and it makes me very happy to know that. I am just going to miss so much! Betsy
Posts.Title: SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2015 06:31PM bethen wrote: wondering if I should ask the Dr. For something for the depression, it is consuming me every waking hour. What do you think?  Betsy
Posts.Title: SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen
SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen

Posts.Content: bethen wrote: Hi Ladies I just need to vent, cry and scream right now. I have been in a dark dark place for the last three months. I will fill you in. First diagnosed Sept 2005, had chemo, right side mastectomy followed by radiation and a year of herceptin. All went along very well until Feb 2010, back in lymph node below collarbone, again another six months of chemotherapy and believe it or not they gave me radiation yet again this time twice a day with it being delivered at a minimum of six hours apart. They were very careful not to overlap the fields. This was followed by being put on herceptin again. Fast forward to 2012 again another lymph node in the same area, again chemo and this time told herceptin would be forever. Had to go off herceptin for six months as heart function was beginning to drastically decline. Feb 2014 yet again back in a couple of lymph node and yet again chemo with herceptin, continued chemo until sept and was cut off herceptin in November again due to heart function. After my second round of chemo I developed lymphedema and have continued with the pain and discomfort of it, having to wear a sling is horrible that on top of the fact that my shoulder is dislocate and nobody will fix it as the muscles will not hold it due to the weight of the arm. Also I have brachial plexopathy from radiation. Now shortly before Christmas I thought I had pulled something in my leg in the groin area, it got worse and worse to the point that i could not walk, so my husband called the ambulance and off I went to the hospital at which point I found out that I needed a new hip as well as a new pelvis had to be made from mesh and cement as the cancer had now taken over in these areas. I spent over two weeks in the hospital awaiting a surgery slot. Surgery went well, the recovery has been slow as I have lost a lot of weight and am weak. Last week I started having a lot of pain in my groin, bum cheek and it hurt horribly every time I sat down, felt like I was sitting on a knife. Every time I wiped after urinating something felt wrong. Turns out one of the rods used in the pelvic reconstruction had come loose and migrated away from the location it should have been in. I had to have it removed, it was pokin out below my skin half was between the anus opening. And the vagina. Now tomorrow I am going to see my oncologist and have no idea what she will want to do to me this time, I feel like I have fought so long and now that it has spread into the bones is not good. What do they usually give you for the mets in the bones. Sorry this is so long but I am very very upset and would just like to hear from others. Thanks for any ideas and your help. Betsy Betsy Dx 9/27/2005, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, 3/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2015 08:53PM bethen wrote: thanks Heather  Betsy

Posts.Title: SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2015 10:00AM bethen wrote: Not the news I was wanting to hear. Saw my oncologist and pain specialist last Wed. And was told that I have about six months or a little less. Back on fentanyl 100's with hydromorphone 4's every hour for breakthrough pain. So far the pain has not changed, how long do I give it to work before I call them? Both dr's could not believe that a rod came loose from my hip surgery and worked its way out of my body, I am still pretty sore from that experience I feel like I am bruised badly in that area and it is making walking harder. I was doing so good coming back from the hip replacement surgery until this happened now I feel like I am starting at the beginning again. Dr. Explained no more herceptin or chemo for me as they both can have implications on heart function and I have had that problem a few times before. It is now just a waiting game and a matter of pain control. I really am having a hard time wrapping my head around everything, can't seem to accept it yet, how do you do that? I was looking forward to my sons wedding in Sept., now I won't be there and it devastates me. My husband is a basket case but trying to be so strong for me, he believes he can keep me at home and take care of me, now this is a precious thought but unrealistic, I need to fine someplace to go when I get too bad. I am totally overwhelmed by thoughts and feelings both mentally and physically. My oncologist was a little emotional, when I was leaving her office she gave me a big hug and reminded me that they are all there for me and I hugged her back and thanked her for giving me the ten extra years I got since diagnosis. I have said it before and I am sure I will say it again, I am scared and terrified.  Betsy
Posts.Title: SO VERY SCARED, DEPRESSED and CONFUSEEd bethen bethen

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2013 05:53PM bethen wrote: OMG I get the exact same headaches and boy oh boy are they ever terrifying when they happen.  Suddenly there are spots missing in your vision.  The first time it happened to me i thought something was in my eye and rubbed it. but of course nothing changed.  Even though I know what to expect when the aura happens it is still a bit terrifying. Betsy
Posts.Title: and I'm crying again, sappy self-absorbed vent debmc1958 debmc1958

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2012 09:04PM bethen wrote: Just had my fourth of twelve treatments yesterday.  So far this had been very tolerable, all I have noticed is some muscle aches in my claves and tiredness, but that is to be expected.  The pre-meds take care of the nausea, but there is constipation that too can be dealt with.  So far so good, we will see how it goes.  What a difference between this drug and Taxotere.
Posts.Title: Need Info on Navelbine LuAnnH jcb51

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 03:24AM bethen wrote: Hi....You know lately I have never even questioned my stage, when diagnosed in 2005 I was stage 3.  Then in 2010 I had a recurrance in two lymph nodes deep within my pectoral muscle on the same side that I had my mastectomy on.  Now just in Dec. 2011 there is another node that has popped up.  So I suppose that now I am actually a stage 4.  I have been getting herceptin since May 2010 and at that time I also did 6 rounds of Taxotere.  This time however they decided to give me the Navelbine along with the Herceptin.  My schedule goes one week Herceptin and Navelbine, and the next week just Navelbine, the following week off and then I repeat this schedule for six cycles.  Will see what this brings and if the Navelbine works.  Taxotere was not given again (thank god, that really made me sick) due to the fact that I already had it back in 2005 and again 2010, obviously it did not do much good.  I have also had radiation twice, and they will not do it again as the radiation fields would cross too much.  Hopefully the Navelbine will give me more time.   Betsy
Posts.Title: Anyone on Navalbine in StageIII? Quaatsi bethen

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2013 08:49PM bethen wrote: I recently was forced to stop Herceptin due to a drop in my ejection fraction, it will be interesting to see if the cardiologist that I see in two weeks puts me on beta blockers and if so I hope they will let me restart Herceptin.  Is this common to start it again after getting beta blockers. Betsy
Posts.Title: beta blockers debbiej mnmom3

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2012 01:26AM bethen wrote: Hi I had a re-diagnoses in 2009 of infraclavicular nodes (2) four and a half years after original diagnoses, had six rounds of Taxotere and boost radiation to those two nodes.  But just this past December another node showed up on routine CT Scan.  Started Navelbine with Herceptin and just today at the half way mark of my chemo, found out that my repeat CT scan cannot detect any disease.  So something is definately finally working.  By the way, I was the one that found this new cancer because when I touched my chest below my collarbone it felt thicker and firmer than the other side, so I questioned the dr. about it.  The tumor is also pretty deep in the pectoral muscle which made is inoperable.   Betsy
Posts.Title: supraclavicular node kate73 bethen

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 12:28PM bethen wrote: Sonata So very glad that you went to the ER.  We all know when are body's are not right and the time when something is really wrong.  I had a TIA when I was pregnent at 29 years old.  It really is scarry, on top of the numbness I also temporarily lost the vision in my right eye.  It is so frightening when it happens to you.  Thank god you are better and that you went for help,  You are right, that if you left it the result would have been horrible.  Keep well, you will surely feel better now that you are back in your own home. Betsy
Posts.Title: Update on ER visit Sonata meima-Bev

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 04:25PM bethen wrote: I am starting Navelbine tomorrow.  I will be having three weeks on Navelbine followed by the fourth week on Herceptin.  This is going to continue for 6 cycles.  So I am weekly now for about 6 months.  Lets post our experiences with Navelbine, I too also notice not many people seem to be on this drug.   Betsy
Posts.Title: Anyone on Navalbine in StageIII? Quaatsi bethen

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 07:26PM bethen wrote: Going for my second treatment tomorrow.  First one was OK.  I have had some acid reflux type of symptoms, but that is all so far.  We will see how it goes and I get more and more of this drug introducted into my body.
Posts.Title: Anyone on Navalbine in StageIII? Quaatsi bethen

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 04:40PM bethen wrote: Kathleen26 The first recurrance in May 2010 it was myself that found it, I noticed that right below my collar bone it felt thicker, almost as if I had a hard little muscle there.  I showed my oncologist and at first she thought that maybe it was because I was right handed and therefor the muscle on that side would be a bit bigger than on the other side,  But, I am LEFT handed and since I had no other symptoms she decided to CT it right away, so two days later I found out that it was 2 lymph nodes that were involved.  This past timejust in Dec 2011  I had a 6 month routine follow up CT on Dec 23 and found out Dec 28 that there was a new lymph node involved and so begins my journey on Navelbine. Betsy
Posts.Title: Anyone on Navalbine in StageIII? Quaatsi bethen
